abstract: The ranking Republican on the Senate Banking Committee said that he would vote against the financial regulatory bill, setting the stage for what could be a contentious and drawn-out set of negotiations.
snippet: The ranking Republican on the Senate Banking Committee said that he would vote against the financial regulatory bill, setting the stage for what could be a contentious and drawn-out set of negotiations.
lead_paragraph: Senator Richard C. Shelby of Alabama, the ranking Republican on the Senate Banking Committee, said Thursday that he would vote against the financial regulatory bill proposed last week by Senator Christopher J. Dodd, the Connecticut Democrat who is the committee’s chairman, setting the stage for what could be a contentious and drawn-out set of negotiations.

headline.main: Shelby Opposes Dodd’s Financial Regulatory Bill
